result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler M. Polum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Consecutive to: 15CM225

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant asking about jail time, Judge response sentences in 2 files run concurrently to each other, but consecutive to other charges

Defendant Tyler M. Polum in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Tyler M. Polum in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments and recommendations made by DA and Attny Haacke.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court orders 90 days jail, consecutive, $10 + costs and DNA sample.
Absolute sobriety.  No entry into Class B licensed establishments.

Attorney Steve Weerts appeared by video means for Defendant Tyler M. Polum.  Attorney Haacke represents the defendant but unavailable today.   Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant has 30 days to appear or his bond money will be forfeited.

Attorney Ronald Duane Haacke in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  $2,000 cash warrant authorized.  Start forfeiture of bond money.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler M. Polum appears by video, in custody with Attorney  Weerts appearing in courtroom.    Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weerts believes Atty R.
